title: China Sells $4 Billion of Dollar Bonds, Borrowing Cheaply Once Again
summary: The four-part deal comprised bonds that mature in three, five, 10 and 30 years. China raised $4 billion from a sale of U.S. dollar bonds, borrowing cheaply again from international investors that flocked to its offering despite the country's slowing economic growth.

title: China's New Home Prices Fall for First Time in Six Years as Rules Bite
summary: Average prices in 70 major cities edged down 0.08% in September from August, the first such month-on-month decline since 2015. BEIJING-New home prices in China fell on a monthly basis for the first time in more than six years in September, new official data showed, as Beijing's measures to curb housing speculation and cool the property sector begin to bite.

title: Covid-19 Fight Heats Up Between Biden and States
summary: Labor Department moves to revoke workplace safety oversight from Utah, Arizona and South Carolina, saying they have failed to adopt more-rigorous standards. The Labor Department is moving to strip three Republican-led states of workplace safety oversight, saying they have failed to adopt more-rigorous Covid-19 safety standards. It is the latest development in a fight between the Biden administration and some states over federal coronavirus rules.

title: FBI Raids Homes Owned by Relatives of Russian Oligarch Oleg Deripaska
summary: Metals tycoon, who figured in post-2016 investigations, was under U.S. sanctions imposed in 2018. The Federal Bureau of Investigation on Tuesday conducted raids of residences in Washington and New York owned by the family of Russian metals tycoon Oleg Deripaska, who figured prominently in the post-2016 investigations of Trump campaign officials, FBI spokeswomen and a spokesman for Mr. Deripaska said.

title: Jan. 6 Committee Recommends Contempt Charge for Bannon
summary: Former Trump adviser has declined to cooperate after panel investigating Capitol attack issued subpoena. WASHINGTON-The House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol voted 9-0 Tuesday to recommend holding Stephen Bannon, a onetime adviser to former President Donald Trump, in criminal contempt for defying a congressional subpoena.

title: Navy Faults Seamen, Captains, Admirals in Loss of Ship Destroyed by Fire
summary: Navy charges the fire had been set, but failures throughout the ranks doomed the crew's response. A series of failures starting with sailors and reaching as high as Navy admirals was to blame for the loss of a U.S. amphibious assault ship in a five-day fire last year, a report set to be released Wednesday has concluded, Navy officials said.

title: Netflix Co-CEO Says He 'Screwed Up' When Defending Chappelle Special
summary: 'I should have recognized the fact that a group of our employees was really hurting,' Ted Sarandos says in interview. Netflix Inc. Co-Chief Executive Ted Sarandos said he "screwed up" in his efforts to communicate with employees who were upset over "The Closer," a recent comedy special by Dave Chappelle in which he made remarks that some viewed as offensive to the transgender community.

title: Biden Identifies Cuts to Social Policy and Climate Bill
summary: Community college, clean electricity program could be dropped, while other programs may be slimmed down. WASHINGTON-Democrats accelerated efforts to strike a deal on their social-policy and climate legislation, as President Biden identified programs that party lawmakers could eliminate or slim down during a flurry of meetings at the White House Tuesday.

title: Marriott Failed to Properly Disclose Resort Fees, Prosecutors Say
summary: Prosecutors say Marriott violates consumer-protection laws by failing to disclose the fees upfront. Marriott International Inc. and its hotels have collected hundreds of millions of dollars in resort fees from hotel guests over the past 10 years, according to the District of Columbia attorney general's office, which is suing the company over what it alleges are deceptive pricing tactics related to the fees.

title: Treasury Seeks More Money for Illicit-Finance Oversight, Including Crypto and Cybercrime
summary: Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo says hiring more staff with technology expertise is critical. The Biden administration's financial intelligence and sanctions units need significantly more funding and staff to combat national-security threats, including ones arising from ransomware and cryptocurrency markets, the Treasury Department's second in command told lawmakers Tuesday.

title: Omnicom's Revenue Improves as Effects of Pandemic Fade
summary: The ad agency holding company says revenue is growing across sectors and regions. Omnicom Group Inc. said its business continued to improve from the damage and disruption caused by the Covid-19 pandemic, with third-quarter organic revenue gains in each of the advertising company's major disciplines.

title: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel Says Regulation Alone Won't Fix Social Media
summary: Business practices need to support users' well-being, chief executive says at WSJ Tech Live conference. The boss of social-media company Snap Inc. says government regulation isn't a substitute for companies working to promote the well-being of their users.

title: Boeing's First Astronaut Flight on Starliner Faces Further Delay
summary: Aerospace giant still trying to determine why valves on space vehicle's propulsion system became stuck. Boeing Co. executives said the company's Starliner space vehicle might not carry astronauts until the end of next year, potentially putting it a year behind a previous date to deliver people to orbit for NASA.

title: Netflix Adds More Users Than It Predicted, Boosted by 'Squid Game'
summary: Streaming service adds roughly 4.4 million subscribers amid increased competition and the typical summer slowdown. Netflix Inc. added 4.4 million memberships in the third quarter, more than the company had forecast, as viewers flocked to the streaming platform with the return of popular series and new hits such as "Squid Game."

title: Former Theranos Product Manager Details Shortcuts as Devices Failed
summary: Daniel Edlin says his job included scripted tours and decoy blood-testing devices. SAN JOSE, Calif.-Testimony from a former Theranos Inc. product manager in the criminal fraud trial of Elizabeth Holmes has shed light on the startup's race to court investors and business partners and the shortcuts it took when its blood-testing devices failed.

title: A Bitcoin ETF Is Here. What Does That Mean?
summary: With ProShares launching its exchange-traded fund, others are expected to follow as the SEC considers additional proposals. The first bitcoin exchange-traded fund started trading Tuesday, making the most widely traded cryptocurrency available to most investors with a brokerage account. Here is a look at what it means.

title: Day Traders Are Driving Uranium Prices Higher
summary: Individual traders flock to Canadian uranium investment trust that has snapped up nuclear fuel and boosted prices. Enthusiasm from individual traders is reshaping the market for nuclear fuel that generates a tenth of the world's electricity and sending uranium-linked stocks higher.

title: Credit Suisse Spied on Seven Executives, Broke Swiss Rules, Regulator Says
summary: Switzerland's top financial cop says bank's senior management knew about some of the surveillance; firm had blamed rogue employees. Credit Suisse Group AG's efforts to spy on top executives were broader than previously known and broke Swiss supervisory law, that country's financial regulator said Tuesday.

title: Who Gets 'Canceled'?
summary: Students discuss who is being canceled and why.. Editor's note: This Future View discusses who gets "canceled." Next week we'll ask, "Library-science degrees, hotel management degrees, journalism degrees: Is a college degree necessary for nearly every white-collar job these days? Or has America been overtaken by a creeping credentialism?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Oct. 26. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Ethics Shenanigans at the Labor Board
summary: Former SEIU lawyers are poised to rule on SEIU priorities such as the 'joint-employer' rule.. Big Labor has long targeted fast-food chains and other franchise businesses for unionization with little success. So they are again turning to the National Labor Relations Board for help, and the new Biden majority seems willing to dodge ethics rules to oblige.

title: GOP Congressman Jeff Fortenberry Indicted in Campaign Finance Probe
summary: Nebraska lawmaker is alleged to have lied about accepting 2016 campaign funds from a foreign billionaire. WASHINGTON-A federal grand jury indicted Nebraska Republican Rep. Jeff Fortenberry on charges of lying and misleading federal investigators about illegal campaign contributions tied to his 2016 campaign for Congress.

title: The GameStop Scandal That Wasn't
summary: An SEC staff report finds no evidence of market manipulation.. Cleanup in aisle 7! Some days we feel like the grocery store mop brigade wiping up after the political class erupts in a tempest that leaves a mess of falsehoods on the floor. The latest example is the Securities and Exchange Commission staff report that failed to find a scandal in the trading this year in GameStop and other "meme" stocks.

title: Netflix Engagement Increased 14% During Facebook Outage
summary: As Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp went dark, users turned to other outlets. When Facebook Inc.'s services went offline for as much as six hours in early October, engagement with Netflix Inc . increased by 14%, the streaming giant said.

title: Bank of New York Mellon's Profit Rises on New Business, Asset Growth
summary: The custody bank's results beat Wall Street's expectations. Bank of New York Mellon Corp. reported a higher third-quarter profit, as a robust stock market, busy clients and new business all helped lift revenue.

title: Iran Won't Stop Until It Has a Nuclear Weapon
summary: Khamenei and his regime haven't gone to all this trouble merely to become a 'threshold state.'. It is a common hope within Washington's foreign-policy establishment that no matter how close Iran gets to the atomic threshold, it won't detonate a bomb. The intelligence community claims Tehran isn't currently taking steps to build a nuclear weapon. Many want to believe that Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei's fatwa against the production and use of nuclear weapons will keep Iran a threshold state. These hopes are delusional.

title: Democrats Try to Salvage IRS Bank-Account Reporting With Scaled-Back Plan
summary: Key reporting threshold would go to $10,000 from $600; banks, GOP say plan is unworkable. Democrats scaled back a proposal to require banks to send to the IRS more information about customers' accounts in hopes of salvaging the idea, raising to $10,000 from $600 the key reporting threshold and adding an exemption that would spare many workers and retirees.

title: Netflix Finds Even 'Squid Game' Only Has So Much Reach
summary: While new blockbuster series helps lift subscriber growth, a projection that is only in line with forecasts tempers the reaction following a stock-price surge. For Netflix , recovering from the post-pandemic slump is proving to be a complicated plotline.

title: What Colin Powell Learned From His Own Story
summary: Anyone can go as far as his talents will take him-only in America.. It was September 1995, and the world was beating a path to Colin Powell's door. Rumors swirled about a possible run for the White House.

title: San Francisco Has Become a Shoplifter's Paradise
summary: Walgreens has closed 22 stores in the city, where thefts under $950 are effectively decriminalized.. The connection between crime control and social inequality doesn't get a lot of attention in the media, but last week's decision by pharmacy chain Walgreens to close five more stores in San Francisco because of rampant shoplifting is another reason why it should.

title: Netflix Isn't Brave, and That's Fine
summary: In sticking up for Dave Chappelle, it's really defending its own leadership.. Public companies are not in the business of self-sacrificial gestures for reasons of principle or any other reason.

title: 'Master of the Game' Review: The Uneven Paths to Peace
summary: Liberal internationalists prefer quick dashes and world transformation. Henry Kissinger counseled a slower, messier course.. An account of Henry Kissinger's Middle East diplomacy in the 1970s may not strike many readers as timely. It's nearly 45 years since Mr. Kissinger left the State Department, and the United States today seems bent on withdrawing from the Middle East. But Martin Indyk's lucidly conceived and compellingly written "Master of the Game: Henry Kissinger and the Art of Middle East Diplomacy" is much more than a tale of long-ago diplomatic tussles in a faraway place. The issues surrounding Mr. Kissinger's approach to foreign policy remain current, and Mr. Indyk brings to the task of examining them his years of diplomatic experience in the Clinton and Obama administrations. His book deserves careful attention.

title: SPAC Shareholders Approve Deal That Will Take WeWork Public
summary: BowX says deal is expected to provide the shared-workspace company with cash proceeds of about $1.3 billion. Special purpose acquisition company BowX Acquisition Corp. said Tuesday its shareholders approved the previously announced business combination with shared-workspace company WeWork Inc.

title: United Airlines' Profit Dented by Delta Variant
summary: Carrier's quarterly revenue outpaces analysts' targets; $473 million in profits include final government grants to pay workers. United Airlines Holdings Inc. said the spread of the more-contagious variant of Covid-19 slowed flying during the third quarter but hasn't derailed its recovery.

title: Credit Suisse to Pay Fine, Admits Defrauding Investors to Settle Mozambique Charges
summary: Bank hid information about Mozambican loans from investors; bankers, others siphoned off funds. Credit Suisse Group AG agreed to pay $475 million and forgive $200 million Mozambique owes to investors in coordinated settlements with U.S. and European authorities over loans the bank made in the country.

title: U.S. to Issue Migration Appeal to South American Nations
summary: Blinken, in a meeting in Colombia, will urge countries to share responsibility for migration patterns. QUITO, Ecuador-The Biden administration is trying to enlist South American countries to help halt a new wave of migration by controlling the flow of migrants northward, officials said, stressing that all Latin American countries have a role to play.

title: 'Dave Chappelle Is Welcome on Substack,' CEO Says
summary: Speaking at WSJ Tech Live, Chris Best says that censoring controversial remarks doesn't work and contradicts free speech. Substack Inc. co-founder and CEO Chris Best said he wouldn't have removed a post or delisted Dave Chappelle if the comedian had published something on the platform that echoed his recent stand-up special on Netflix Inc.

title: Congress Is Losing Patience With Big-Tech Resistance, Klobuchar Says
summary: Democratic senator says the push for regulation got a boost from the disclosure of some of Facebook's internal research. WASHINGTON-Congress is growing impatient with big technology companies for resisting legislative remedies aimed at addressing social harms from internet platforms, Sen. Amy Klobuchar said Tuesday.

title: Stocks Close Higher as Companies Report Earnings
summary: Investors assess how companies are faring with labor shortages, higher energy costs and supply-chain woes. The S&P 500 notched its highest close in six weeks as investors parsed earnings reports to see how companies are managing inflation and supply-chain woes.

title: First Bitcoin Futures ETF Rises in Trading Debut
summary: ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF advances nearly 5% following its closely watched launch. The first bitcoin-focused exchange-traded fund rose in its trading debut Tuesday after getting a warm reception from investors.

title: How the Grateful Dead Enlivened the Record Industry
summary: Released 50 years ago this week, the group's second live double album, nicknamed 'Skull and Roses,' captured the vibe of their legendary concerts.

title: Texas Redistricting Tests Whether Minority Population Gains Will Translate Into Political Clout
summary: Resume Subscription. AUSTIN, Texas-Texas is emerging as a central test of whether the nation's minority residents, who account for all U.S. population growth over the past decade, will gain additional voting clout as states redraw their U.S. House district lines.

title: 'Found' Review: Families Near and Far
summary: In Amanda Lipitz's Netflix documentary, three adopted cousins find one another and then return to China to search for their past. 'Found"-about three very American girls who were adopted from China-introduces its subjects in a terrific sequence that bounces around their worlds: Chloe being bat mitzvahed in Jerusalem; Sadie taking orders at a Sonic in Nashville, Tenn.; Lily poised to graduate from a Catholic high school in Oklahoma City. Are they out of place? As the documentary makes clear, that's the thing they have to decide for themselves.

title: Open-Source Startup Aiven Raises $60 Million in New Funding
summary: Investors are betting on rising interest among CIOs for in-house software development efforts. Aiven Inc., a cloud-based open-source software services firm, raised $60 million in a second funding round in less than a year, as investors bet on growing demand from chief information officers for ready access to shared computer code.

title: Woke at Wellesley Public Schools
summary: Parents sue over policies that segregate students and chill speech.. Critical race theory dominates college campuses these days, but parents are fighting its spread to K-12 education. Three Massachusetts families are suing Wellesley Public Schools over woke policies they say violate their children's rights.

title: 'South Park' Creators Face Rival Bankruptcy Bid for Casa Bonita
summary: An enthusiast of the restaurant and family entertainment center says he can do better than the $3.1 million offer from Trey Parker and Matt Stone. The creators of "South Park" are facing competition to buy Casa Bonita, the bankrupt restaurant and family entertainment center outside Denver that was featured in an episode of the TV show.

title: Apollo Targets $1 Trillion in Assets, Aiming to Outpace Blackstone
summary: Investing giant hopes Athene acquisition will supercharge its AUM growth. Apollo Global Management Inc. said it expects its assets under management to double to about $1 trillion by 2026, setting up a race with fellow investment behemoth Blackstone Inc., which has set the same lofty target.

title: GE, Union Pacific Mandate Covid-19 Vaccine for U.S. Workers
summary: More large U.S. companies are imposing vaccine requirements to meet a deadline of Dec. 8 for federal contractors. General Electric Co. , Union Pacific Corp. and other large U.S. employers are imposing Covid-19 vaccine mandates for their workers to comply with a Dec. 8 deadline set by the Biden administration for companies that are federal contractors.

title: Secrets to Cooking Pro Pizza at Home: The Best Gear, Recipes and Tricks
summary: Pizza-making at home is the new pandemic craze, but it can seem intimidating. Here's the ultimate guide to get you going: from party-friendly backyard pizza ovens to insider recipes, topping tips and much more.. IT WAS as good a reason as any to make pizza: "During the pandemic, I needed to have some sort of passion," said Frédéric della Faille, a product designer in New York City.

title: It's Not Your Turn for Shortages
summary: Americans have every right to demand a prosperous society.. Selling the Joe Biden-Bernie Sanders era of scarcity won't be easy. And it's going to get much harder if the President and his legislative co-author enact their massive new plan to discourage productive labor.

title: Procter & Gamble Uses Size to Lessen Impact of Supply-Chain Mess
summary: P&G, Ikea and Albertsons are among the large companies tapping alternative sources of inventory to keep shelves stocked. Procter & Gamble Co. said that it expects solid sales and profit growth over the next nine months, even as costs for everything from warehouse space to raw materials rise faster than the consumer-products company expected.

title: Travelers Profit Falls 20% on Hurricane Ida, Auto Claims
summary: Property-casualty insurer's catastrophe losses rose to $501 million pretax in the third quarter. Property-casualty insurer Travelers Cos. posted a 20% decline in net income in the third quarter, weighed down by storm-damage and car-wreck-related claims.

title: Teen Girls Are Developing Tics. Doctors Say TikTok Could Be a Factor.
summary: Resume Subscription. Teenage girls across the globe have been showing up at doctors' offices with tics-physical jerking movements and verbal outbursts-since the start of the pandemic.

title: Now You See It, Now You Don't (Wednesday Crossword, October 20)
Where to Travel for Thanksgiving-5 No-Fuss Getaways
summary: From a Cape Cod resort to a Chicago luxury hotel, indulgent alternatives to slaving over the bird-each featuring a fabulous feast. HOW MANY TIMES have you cooked and eaten at home during the last 20 months? For many Americans, the number is...a lot. So, for this Thanksgiving, might we suggest an indulgent alternative to making your own meal: Change your scenery and let someone else slave over the stove. With a few precautions, you can skip the awkward family Zoom and instead overdo it on tryptophan together by the shore of the Atlantic, in the hills of Texas, surrounded by wineries in Oregon, or in an architectural marvel in the center of Chicago. A chef will be doing the shopping, cooking and cleaning. To them we give thanks.

title: CAA Co-Chairman Says Company Mines Streaming Data for Movie Deals
summary: Lovett says protecting stars and making deals is challenging in era of at-home entertainment. Creative Artists Agency Co-Chairman Richard Lovett said that making deals for clients is more challenging in the age of streaming than it was previously.

title: Elijah McClain's Family Reaches Settlement With City
summary: Details still being finalized for agreement over young Black man's 2019 death after police detained him. The family of Elijah McClain, an unarmed Black man who died after he was stopped by police while walking home from a Colorado convenience store in 2019, have reached a settlement with the city of Aurora, representatives for both parties said Tuesday.

title: Afghanistan Withdrawal to Be Subject of State Department Investigation
summary: Internal watchdog tells Congress it will review handling of embassy planning, refugees and special immigrant visa program. WASHINGTON-The State Department's internal watchdog has informed U.S. lawmakers that it has begun to investigate policy planning behind the suspension of operations at the U.S. Embassy in Afghanistan, leading up to the Taliban takeover of Kabul in August.

title: 'Fidelio' Review: A Harsh Sentence
summary: San Francisco Opera new production of Beethoven's work, set in a detention facility, might leave some hoping for an early release.. San Francisco

title: Auto Risks Are Dragging on Insurance Stocks
summary: Slow-moving risks in the auto business seem to be a bigger concern for shares of insurers like Travelers than catastrophes such as Hurricane Ida. Big and sudden catastrophes like hurricanes are part of doing business for insurers. Investors may be more preoccupied with slow-moving risks, particularly in autos.

title: The Murdaugh Murders: What to Know About Alex Murdaugh and His Legal Challenges
summary: Downfall of family dynasty involves five fatalities, at least seven state and federal investigations and millions of dollars unaccounted for. Disgraced lawyer Alex Murdaugh is jailed and facing charges of swindling his late housekeeper's sons out of millions of dollars in an insurance settlement. That is just one of the legal challenges facing the scion of one of South Carolina's most powerful families, in a quickly unraveling saga with five fatalities, at least seven state and federal investigations and millions of dollars unaccounted for.

title: Country Star Travis Tritt Cancels Some Concerts Over Covid-19 Vaccine Requirements
summary: Pandemic has complicated industry's plans for a return to live performances. Travis Tritt, the country music singer, is canceling several upcoming shows at venues with Covid-19 restrictions such as face-mask or vaccination requirements, as musicians continue to navigate holding live events during the pandemic.

title: Charter Appoints New CFO, Fills Other Top Roles in Management Shuffle
summary: The cable giant promoted finance executive Jessica Fischer to CFO as part of a string of management changes. Charter Communications Inc. promoted a company insider to the role of finance chief as part of a string of management changes unveiled ahead of President John Bickham's retirement at the end of next year.

title: How to Make Sure Your Smartphone, Tablet and Other Devices Are Always Charged
summary: Resume Subscription. If your phone, tablet or smartwatch isn't charged, then it isn't a mobile device-it's a paperweight. But keeping all these devices charged, at home and on the go, is no small feat.

title: Facebook Settles With U.S. Government Over Improperly Reserving Jobs for Immigrants
summary: The social-media company faces more than $14 million in penalties tied to the federal probe. Facebook Inc. has agreed to pay a financial penalty as part of settlements with the U.S. government that had accused the social-media company of illegally reserving lucrative jobs for immigrant workers it was sponsoring for permanent residence instead of searching for and considering available U.S. workers.

title: Instacart Expects More Growth in Grocery Delivery
summary: Despite slower demand, CEO Fidji Simo says customers won't revert to pre-pandemic patterns: 'It has changed consumer habits forever'. Instacart Inc.'s chief executive said the company foresees more runway for growth in grocery delivery, saying the Covid-19 pandemic has fueled lasting changes in the way consumers buy food.

title: Alex Murdaugh Denied Bail in South Carolina on Fraud Charges
summary: Lawyer was arrested last week on charges related to misappropriating insurance settlement money. COLUMBIA, S.C.-A state court judge denied bond to former lawyer Alex Murdaugh on Tuesday, saying he wanted an independent psychiatric evaluation before determining whether Mr. Murdaugh would be a danger to himself or others if released.

title: How to Build a More Sustainable Robot
summary: Resume Subscription. Robots are often hulking machines made of gleaming new metal parts and running on traditional energy sources. But as governments and environmental groups try to figure out how to meet climate goals, some roboticists are pushing their ideas for reimagined robots made of recycled, biodegradable and replaceable parts.

title: Johnson & Johnson's Sales Climb Across Divisions
summary: Company's revenue rose 11% year over year in third quarter to $23.34 billion. Johnson & Johnson 's sales climbed in the latest quarter compared with the same stretch of last year, reflecting a return of more doctor's visits and medical procedures after the pandemic disrupted the industry.

title: ESPN Reporter Allison Williams Quits Over Vaccine Mandate, Fertility Concerns. Many Share Her Fears.
summary: Covid-19 vaccine hesitancy among women who are pregnant or trying to conceive remains high, despite no links found between the shots and fertility problems. ESPN reporter Allison Williams's decision to leave the network over a Covid-19 vaccine requirement underscores the battle that doctors say they are waging to convince pregnant women, and those planning a pregnancy, to get the shots.

title: Biden's Real Tax Target Isn't the Superrich
summary: His plan would sock it to the 'working rich,' whose taxes are already high, not billionaire investors.. The Biden administration is trying to sell its Build Back Better agenda by demonizing the superwealthy, but that's just the sales pitch. The actual product is a tax bill sent mostly elsewhere, to the already highly taxed "working rich."

summary: The trans-Atlantic alliance is in trouble if our friends abroad won't confront China.. Estoril, Portugal

title: U.K., Joining Trend, Sees Nuclear As Key to Cut Carbon Emissions
summary: Britain's plan for net-zero carbon output by 2050 includes new nuclear investments, with China, France and India also expanding production. The U.K. said Tuesday that nuclear power would play an important role in underpinning its plan to cut greenhouse-gas emissions, joining a growing group of countries turning back to atomic energy as they consider how to wean themselves off fossil fuels.

title: Google's Pixel 6 and 6 Pro: Their Maker Gets Serious About Smartphones. For Real This Time.
summary: The latest Pixel smartphones have colorful designs, cool camera tricks and powerful Google-designed processors. But how many will buy one instead of a Samsung Galaxy phone or Apple iPhone?. Riddle: I'm the best Android smartphone but no one buys me. What am I?

title: Some Workers Want Covid-19 Recovery Accepted as Evidence of Immunity
summary: Previous infection should be recognized as proof of protection and exempt employees from vaccine mandates, some workers say. Some workers opposed to vaccine mandates on the job are increasingly pointing to the same reason for their objection: They already had Covid-19.

title: Why You'll Want to Dress Like Timothée Chalamet in 'Dune'-Seriously
summary: In the new fantasy epic, the leading man's wardrobe ranges from tailored emerald suits to entirely neutral outfits. How to steal his sci-fi style-because believe it or not, you'll want to.. IF YOU HAVEN'T been back to the movies yet, now might be the time: The long-awaited, thrice-delayed Denis Villeneuve adaptation of Frank Herbert's seminal 1965 novel "Dune" will hit theaters on Oct. 22. The futuristic epic stars Timothée Chalamet doing what he does best: playing an angsty teen, in this case Paul Atreides, on an archetypal hero's journey to save us all. And much like the real-life Mr. Chalamet, his character is nothing short of a fashion plate.

title: Comcast Launches Smart TV for U.S. Market in Bid to Take On Roku, Amazon
summary: China's Hisense will manufacture the XClass TV, which will be sold at Walmart. Comcast Corp. unveiled a smart TV for the U.S. market, as the cable giant looks to become a dominant distributor of streaming apps and give a boost to its homegrown Peacock service.

title: A Chicago Art Museum's Loss-and Ours
summary: 'I owe my entire career as an art historian to the docents of the Art Institute of Chicago.'. Regarding Faith Bottum's op-ed "Indocency on Display at the Art Institute of Chicago" (Oct. 16): The foolish and shortsighted firing of volunteer docents at the Art Institute of Chicago will destroy decades of enlightened outreach to the public-school children of this major city. I know this because I owe my entire career as an art historian to the docents of the Art Institute of Chicago.

title: 'Ray' Actor Jamie Foxx Was Adopted by Older Parents Who Saw His Talent

He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Space Is No Longer Government's Exclusive Domain
summary: Private businesses can and should lead the charge into the final frontier.. Your editorial rightly lauds the "new era" of space "exploration and commerce" spearheaded by the private sector ("Welcome Home, Captain Kirk," Oct. 14). Property rights and market discipline are making it easier than ever to access space.

title: Atea's Covid-19 Oral Treatment Fails in Midstage Trial
summary: Experimental treatment doesn't cut viral load in nonhospitalized patients with mild to moderate symptoms; stock plunges 61%. An oral Covid-19 treatment developed by Atea Pharmaceuticals Inc . failed in a midstage trial, the company said Tuesday, sending the company's stock tumbling.

title: Leave School-Board Elections Alone on the Ballot
summary: Voters will give those races more attention and demand more information.. Michael Hartney advocates pushing school-board and local elections to even years to increase voter turnout and accountability (Letters, Oct. 15). This is one of those ideas that seems great but has negative unintended consequences in practice.

title: Top Schools, the Rich and the Tutor Myth
summary: New York City's elite specialized high schools are full of children who passed the test with the help of a $25 book.. There's nothing that the anti-education education bureaucrats hate more than kids learning outside the classroom ("Bill de Blasio's Parting Gift," Review & Outlook, Oct. 9). New York City's elite specialized high schools, which use an objective test for admission, are full of children who passed the test with the help of a $25 book, which they worked through on their own.

title: Climate Change Rent-Seeking by the Beach
summary: Why shouldn't the rest of us subsidize their vacation homes and fabulous views?. Holman W. Jenkins, Jr. makes a thought-provoking case that insurance will play a vital role in the only sensible climate change strategy: preparation, mitigation and adaptation ("Wait, We Still Want Fossil Fuels?" Business World, Oct. 13). A high insurance premium is nature's way of telling us to reconsider where we build. But those who own beachfront property in the Southeastern U.S. or second homes in fire-prone parts of California won't decide they "want to pay the insurance cost of their amenities" but will quickly seek legislative relief. Why shouldn't the rest of us subsidize their vacation homes and fabulous views?

title: Parkland School Shooting Victims, Families Reach $25 Million Settlement With District
summary: Settlement, which took months to negotiate, will be divided among 52 families and victims. Families and victims of the 2018 school shooting in Parkland, Fla., that left 17 dead have reached a $25 million settlement with the school district.

title: Kitchen Islands-Does Anyone Really Need Two?
summary: Are dual islands-one for prep, one for seating-useful additions to the heart of the home or offensively showy statements of affluence? Design pros debate the growing trend.. Previous installments from the series are here.

summary: The brightly colored species from Asia builds thick webs many feet in diameter; 'so creepy'. ATLANTA-Halloween has come early to Georgia this year-thanks to an invasion of enormous spiders from Asia.

title: Gangs Threaten to Tip Haiti Into a Failed State
summary: Criminal rings, like the one that kidnapped American missionaries, control as much as two-thirds of Haiti, a lawless scenario that threatens regional stability. Gangs in Haiti, such as the one holding a group of American and Canadian missionaries for ransom, have become so powerful that they now challenge the government for control of as much as two-thirds of the country's territory, according to human-rights groups and analysts.

title: China Flooding Exposed Risks in Beijing's Plan to Launch Digital Currency
summary: Resume Subscription. When flooding inundated a central Chinese metropolis over the summer, the calamity dented a key plank of the country's much-watched bid to replace paper money with digital currency: reliability.

title: Johnson & Johnson's Stock Deserves a Booster
summary: Wall Street's excessive focus on vaccine sales creates a buying opportunity for J&J shares. Johnson & Johnson 's Covid-19 vaccine sales are lagging behind its peers. That shouldn't bother its shareholders.

title: Russia's Move to Cut NATO Ties Complicates Biden's Pivot to China
summary: Moscow will withdraw its diplomats and close the alliance's Russian office following NATO's expulsion of Russian officials as spies. BRUSSELS-Moscow's decision to halt its mission to NATO escalates a growing dispute with the alliance and complicates the Biden administration's effort to manage deteriorating relations with Russia as it seeks to focus on China.

title: Facebook Portal Go Review: The Best and Worst Video-Chat Box
summary: The new Portal Go is a fantastic battery-powered smart display for Zoom. Too bad it's so hard to recommend.. The Portal Go is a nearly perfect video-calling gadget. I just wish it didn't come from Facebook Inc.

title: Dover, Procter & Gamble, Travelers, Netflix: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Travelers and Steel Dynamics shares rose on results; Halliburton slipped. Wall Street indexes opened higher amid another flurry of earnings. Here's what we're watching in Tuesday's session.

title: Is Brexit Hurting the U.K. Economy? Trade Data Flash a Warning
summary: Resume Subscription. LONDON-The global upswing in trade is leaving the U.K. behind, an early sign of the challenge Brexit is presenting its economy.

title: Feeling Too Schlubby to Have Sex? It's Not Just You.
summary: Many of us aren't feeling great about our bodies right now, and it's putting a damper on our love lives. Sex therapists' advice: Just start touching.. One evening while watching Netflix with her husband, Nicole Katsulis worked up her nerve and asked him something terrifying: "Why don't you want to have sex with me?"

title: Xi Faces Pushback on China's Bid to Tax Property
summary: Resume Subscription. Chinese President Xi Jinping has made no secret of his desire to deflate China's property bubble. But according to people with knowledge of government deliberations, he is facing resistance over a measure aimed at curbing housing speculation: a nationwide property tax.

title: Brands Count the Rising Cost of Trains, Planes and Automobiles
summary: Big consumer companies will feel varying degrees of pain from supply-chain challenges. No matter the mode of transport, moving goods from A to B has become more expensive. The quirks of consumer companies' supply chains mean they won't all be equally hit.

title: Wildfire Evacuation Fears in Colorado Springs Halt Housing Development
summary: Resume Subscription. COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo.-A plan to build more housing in this fast-growing city has been put on hold because of another pressing concern: wildfire evacuation routes.

title: Victoria Beckham on Her '90s Style: "If I Dressed Like That Now, I'd Be Locked Away By the Fashion Police"
summary: Despite that, her kids are pleading for a comeback of the giant puffers, the leather, the little Gucci dress.... "I will never, ever, ever, ever be allowed to forget that look," Victoria Beckham, the Spice Girl-turned-fashion entrepreneur, says about the matching his-and-hers black leather Gucci motorcycle ensembles she and David Beckham, her footballer-turned-lifestyle entrepreneur husband, were photographed wearing in 1999. "The irony is that we wore full-on leather Gucci to a Versace event for Donatella. Which in itself was just so wrong."

title: China's Power Crisis Has Renewable Energy Seeing Green
summary: Power sector measures triggered by blackouts could help drive next phase of China's green power build-out. China's power crunch may be darkening the sky for now. But it is already shaping up as an impetus for greener electricity in the country.

title: Kushner Cos. Goes Outside the Family to Replace Jared as CEO
summary: Laurent Morali, president of the real-estate company, will take over as chief executive. Jared Kushner's family real-estate company is for the first time turning to a nonfamily member to lead the business, after the former senior White House adviser said that he wouldn't be returning.

title: New York Housing Demand Surges After Pandemic Slowdown
summary: More than 4,500 Manhattan condo and co-op sales closed in third quarter, Douglas Elliman says, the most in the period in over 30 years. New York City's housing market is undergoing a powerful rebound, fueled by New Yorkers trading up, out-of-staters moving in, and others looking beyond the pandemic's aftershocks to make a long-term bet on the city.

title: Newest Class of Corporate Directors Is the Most Diverse Yet, but Gains Are Uneven
summary: A surge of Black nominees and more women join S&P 500 boardrooms, two studies show; half of public companies added no new directors over the past year. U.S. public companies added the most diverse slate of new directors on record to their boards over the past year, with a surge of Black nominees and elevated numbers of women and first-time directors, according to two new studies.

title: The NBA Is One Trade Away From Chaos. Again.
summary: The last three champions were built through deals for star players. The big question as this NBA season begins: Who's next-and where's he going?. The last time anyone saw him in a basketball game, Giannis Antetokounmpo won his first championship with a majestic performance. Kevin Durant was so indomitable that the only thing that could stop him was the length of his toe. Stephen Curry went supernova, LeBron James went home early and Most Valuable Player honors went to a former second-round draft pick who looks like Nikola Jokic.

title: In Social Media, Fortune Favors the Fleeting Snap
summary: Snapchat's early focus on privacy should now pay dividends. Social media's improbable new safe space can be a more profitable one.

title: Apple Now All-In on In-House M1 Chips
summary: Last of its Intel-powered laptops gets upgrade to Apple's M1 chip family following a projected record year for Mac sales. Breaking up may be hard to do, but Apple Inc. made this one look easy.

title: Satellites Sweep for World's Biggest Polluters
summary: Resume Subscription. Satellites are emerging as a tool to fight climate change, exposing hidden sources of greenhouse gas emissions and allowing governments to monitor compliance with international pacts.

title: 'Bad Bets,' Episode 2
summary: How Jeffrey Skilling's rise set the stage for Enron's fall. Former Enron CEO Jeffrey Skilling was arguably the face of Enron's meteoric rise in the '90s. He took a sleepy energy company and turned it into one of the most innovative corporations in the world. By the end, Enron had its fingers in all kinds of projects-including America's nascent broadband networks.

title: Lawmakers Step Up Efforts to Adopt Tougher Tech Laws
summary: Proposals to protect kids online, discourage harmful content gain traction in Congress after years of inaction. WASHINGTON-Legislation to curb the influence of big technology companies, including putting new restrictions on online content, is starting to gain traction in Congress as lawmakers narrow their targets and seek to build on public attention.

title: App Deal Highlights a Push to Lure Workers Back Into Offices
summary: Real-estate data firm VTS is buying office-app developer Lane Technologies for $200 million. Real-estate software and data firm VTS has agreed to acquire an app company that aims to simplify office life as more workers are heading back to their desks.

title: RV Capital Tops WSJ/Realtor.com Housing Index
summary: Index ranks cities for appreciating housing markets and lifestyle amenities. Small U.S. cities dominated The Wall Street Journal/Realtor.com Emerging Housing Markets Index in the third quarter, as high housing costs and remote-work opportunities drive many home buyers to seek out more living and outdoor space.

title: Some Auditors Made Insufficient Assessments of Companies' Revenue and Loan Losses, PCAOB Says
summary: The U.S. audit watchdog inspected 153 audit firms, down 13% from a year earlier. Some auditors need to more thoroughly assess companies' reporting on revenue and credit losses in annual financial statements, the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board said in a report on Monday.

title: Klobuchar, CEOs of Snap, Instacart Headline Second Day
summary: Google's Marian Croak, CAA Co-Chairman Richard Lovett and Headspace Health president are also set to speak. The Wall Street Journal's hybrid Tech Live conference continues for a second day with top executives and regulators set to discuss privacy, big tech regulation and changes in the entertainment industry.

title: See the Full Rankings for WSJ/Realtor.com's Emerging Housing Markets Index
summary: How metro areas across America stack up in the newly updated fall 2021 rankings. Many Americans are still moving to suburban areas because they can work from home. Recent signs of an economic slowdown driven by the Delta variant made people reconsider their plans and kept smaller and more rural housing markets in the top spots for the hottest new places to live and own.

title: Martha Stewart Does NFTs-Jack-o'-Lantern Art and a Seductive Selfie
summary: Lifestyle guru rolls out a line of digital collectibles tied to seasons and holidays; 'I have been cool for a long time, but I'm even more cool now'. Martha Stewart wants to be your crypto queen.

title: Haiti Gang Seeks $17 Million Ransom for Abducted Missionaries
summary: FBI and Haitian police are in contact with the kidnappers and seeking the release of the missionaries; victims include five children.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.
